question: Which of the following is the basic reason for the extraordinary sparkle of a suitably cut diamond?
option1: It has a very high transparency
option2: It has a very high refractive index
answer: It has a very high refractive index
explanation: Diamond has a very high refractive index (about 2.42 compared to about 1.5 for glass). The sparkling isn\'t just the high refractive index - the shape matters too. Diamonds are cut so that a light ray falling on the diamond is reflected multiple times inside the diamond and therefore sends light out in all directions.
